task_summary: Open the pot by removing its lid, place the pot onto the plate, then use the spatula tool to push the pot toward the front edge of the table.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop manipulation scene shows a robot arm, a pot with a removable lid, a small plate, and a spatula-like tool. The robot must first remove or open the pot, then relocate the pot onto the plate. After placing, the robot employs the spatula to push the pot toward the table’s front (camera-bottom) direction. The behavior tree sequences perception, opening, grasping, placing, and tool-mediated pushing with conservative timeouts and modest forces.
preconditions: Pot, lid, plate, and spatula are on the table and visible.
Workspace is clear with no obstacles between end-effector and targets.
Robot gripper and tool-use policies are available.
stepwise_plan: Perceive pot and lid; move above the pot.
Open the pot (remove lid) using an opening primitive.
Compute grasp for the pot and grasp it.
Perceive the plate and place the pot on the plate.
Perceive the spatula and push the pot toward the table’s front.
success_criteria: Lid is no longer covering the pot.
Pot rests stably on the plate.
Final pot pose is shifted toward the front edge compared to its pre-push pose.
failure_and_recovery: If opening fails, retry perception and re-approach before reissuing the open action.
If grasp is unstable, recompute grasp pose and re-grasp.
If placement is off, re-detect plate and re-place.
If push distance is insufficient, issue an additional push.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after a successful push and retreat when all success criteria are satisfied.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: Take the lid off the pot, put the pot on the plate, and use the tool to push to pot to the front of the table.

node_specs.description: Locate the pot in the scene.
Confirm the lid is visible for opening.
Move to a safe pregrasp height above the pot.
Compute a side grasp for the pot and store it.
Confirm plate pose prior to placement.
Place the pot onto the plate.
Localize the tool used for pushing.
Back off to a safe distance after completion.

recovery_strategy: Scan area for tool with wider pattern
assumptions: Frames suggest the small round disk is the lid and the beige round object is the plate; the front of the table corresponds to camera-bottom, encoded as direction 180 degrees.
OpenContainer with container_type 'pot' models lid removal.

expected_success_criteria: Pot is open and no lid on top
Pot translated toward front edge after push
